p: The Madin-Darby Canine Kidney (MDCK) cell line was established in 1958 by Madin and Darby [ 45], and was shown soon afterward to be susceptible to infection by various strains of influenza [ 46, 47]. Apparently, other cell lines, such as kidney cells derived from bovine, chicken and monkeys and even human, were not permissive to viral infections or did not support many cycles of viral replications [ 42].
